faqs.question: What is Addaku Idly?
faqs.answer: Addaku Idly is our signature millet-based idly steamed on a traditional leaf plate (addaku). The leaf imparts a subtle aroma and flavor rooted in Telangana breakfast traditions. It is eco-friendly and connects you to village-style serving.

faqs.question: Which millet is used in Addaku Idly?
faqs.answer: We primarily use foxtail millet (korralu) combined with traditional urad dal for the perfect soft texture and naturally fermented taste.

faqs.question: Is Addaku Idly available for catering?
faqs.answer: Yes! Addaku Idly is one of our most popular catering items. It adds an authentic, eco-friendly touch to weddings, corporate events, and family functions.

faqs.question: Are millet dosas heavy to digest?
faqs.answer: Not at all. Millet dosas are naturally fermented, making them light on the stomach. Millets are fiber-rich and help keep you full longer without feeling heavy.

faqs.question: Are your items suitable for diabetic-friendly diets?
faqs.answer: Millets generally have a lower glycemic index than polished rice. However, we recommend consulting your healthcare provider for specific dietary needs. We are a food business, not a medical service.

faqs.question: Do you use pure ghee?
faqs.answer: Yes. We use pure cow ghee in all our ghee preparations. No vanaspati or artificial substitutes.

faqs.question: What is podi/karam?
faqs.answer: Podi is a traditional Telangana dry spice powder made from roasted lentils, dried red chilies, and sesame seeds. Karam refers to the spicy version. Both are freshly ground in-house.

faqs.question: Do you provide catering services?
faqs.answer: Yes! We cater for weddings, corporate breakfasts, family functions, pelli pandiri events, and more. We bring the full Milletmillodies experience to your venue.

faqs.question: What is the minimum order for catering?
faqs.answer: We can cater for groups as small as 25 people. For larger events of 500+, we offer special menu planning and pricing. Contact us for a custom quote.

faqs.question: How far in advance should I book catering?
faqs.answer: We recommend booking at least 3-5 days in advance for small events and 1-2 weeks for large functions. Last-minute requests are considered based on availability.

faqs.question: Do you provide eco-friendly serving at catering events?
faqs.answer: Absolutely. Our signature Addaku (leaf plate) serving is available for catering. We also use banana leaves and other eco-friendly options to minimize waste.

faqs.question: What are your operating hours?
faqs.answer: We serve breakfast from 6:00 AM to 11:00 AM on weekdays and 6:00 AM to 12:00 PM on weekends. Early morning is when our tiffins are freshest!

faqs.question: Do you offer home delivery?
faqs.answer: We offer parcel/takeaway service. For delivery, you can reach us via WhatsApp to check availability in your area.
